rows.title: What is solid waste?

text.eng:
Solid waste can be everything from:
* Paper waste (paper bags)
* Organic materials (food)
* Plastic waste (bottles)

rows.title: Why should we manage our waste?

title.eng: Why should we manage our waste?

text.eng:
* Reduce breeding grounds for pathogens, bugs, rodents, mosquitos, snakes, and other animals which can spread diseases  
* Protect the environment and water sources  
* Waste can block drains and cause flooding  
* Rotting waste leads to a bad smell, which causes discomfort.  
* It really isn't nice to look at!

rows.title: How to manage solid waste

text.eng:
The disposal/treatment of solid waste depends on the type and amount of waste made. To throw your waste:
* Paper waste can be buried or collected.
* Organic materials can be composted, for instance in household compost pits, and used as fertilizers/soil conditioners for trees and plants around your home.
* Plastic waste can be collected and buried or recycled.
*  And remember, don't place your solid waste in the toilet.

rows.title: Ways to reduce the amount of waste we make

title.eng: Ways to reduce the amount of waste we make

text.eng:
* Carry your own bag to the shops to avoid using a new plastic bag. 
* Use reusable containers, like plastic bottles, rather than buying new ones  
* Try to fix or repair things when they break!
